alert.note: Alert for Edgefield; McCormick (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 5:27AM EST until January 11 at 12:48PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Richland, Calhoun and Lexington Counties. Saluda River At Chappells affecting Greenwood, Saluda and Newberry Counties. Pee Dee River At Cheraw affecting Marlboro and Chesterfield Counties. Stevens Creek Near Modoc affecting Edgefield and McCormick Counties. Wateree River At Lake Wateree affecting Fairfield, Kershaw and Lancaster Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties. Enoree River At Whitmire affecting Union and Newberry Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stevens Creek near Modoc. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Farmland along Stevens Creek above the US Highway 23 bridge near Modoc becomes flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 22.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM EST Wednesday was 22.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 3.5 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 530 PM EST.
